headline: The AI frenzy is driving a new global supply chain crisis
summary: An acute global shortage of memory chips is forcing artificial intelligence and consumer-electronics companies to fight for dwindling supplies, as prices soar for the unglamorous but essential components that allow devices to store data.  Tech giants including Microsoft, Google and ByteDance are scrambling to secure supplies from memory-chip makers such as Micron, Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix, according to three people familiar with the discussions.

content.title: The AI frenzy is driving a new global supply chain crisis
content.summary: An acute global shortage of memory chips is forcing artificial intelligence and consumer-electronics companies to fight for dwindling supplies, as prices soar for the unglamorous but essential components that allow devices to store data.  Tech giants including Microsoft, Google and ByteDance are scrambling to secure supplies from memory-chip makers such as Micron, Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix, according to three people familiar with the discussions.

headline: Anthropic plans an IPO as early as 2026, FT reports
summary: Anthropic, the artificial intelligence startup backed by Alphabet's Google and Amazon.com, has hired the law firm Wilson Sonsini to prepare for an initial ​public offering that could take place as early as 2026, the Financial Times ‌reported on Tuesday.  An IPO would give the company, which operates the AI chatbot Claude, a more efficient way to ‌raise capital and provide leverage for bigger acquisitions through public stock.  The company ⁠has previously turned to Wilson Sonsini ‌for a range of corporate matters.

content.title: Anthropic plans an IPO as early as 2026, FT reports
content.summary: Anthropic, the artificial intelligence startup backed by Alphabet's Google and Amazon.com, has hired the law firm Wilson Sonsini to prepare for an initial ​public offering that could take place as early as 2026, the Financial Times ‌reported on Tuesday.  An IPO would give the company, which operates the AI chatbot Claude, a more efficient way to ‌raise capital and provide leverage for bigger acquisitions through public stock.  The company ⁠has previously turned to Wilson Sonsini ‌for a range of corporate matters.

headline: Foxconn subsidiary plans to expand production in Vietnam, document shows
summary: Fushan Technology, a subsidiary of Taiwanese electronics manufacturer Foxconn, is seeking ​a permit to expand production in Vietnam ‌to make Xbox gaming devices and other electronic parts, according to ‌a company document sent to Bac Ninh province's environmental department.  Fushan ‌Technology's facility, originally a manufacturing plant for Nokia and Microsoft mobile devices, can also produce up to 100,000 unmanned aerial vehicles, or drones, per year, the document said.  Fushan Technology Vietnam did not immediately respond ⁠to a request for comment.

content.title: Foxconn subsidiary plans to expand production in Vietnam, document shows
content.summary: Fushan Technology, a subsidiary of Taiwanese electronics manufacturer Foxconn, is seeking ​a permit to expand production in Vietnam ‌to make Xbox gaming devices and other electronic parts, according to ‌a company document sent to Bac Ninh province's environmental department.  Fushan ‌Technology's facility, originally a manufacturing plant for Nokia and Microsoft mobile devices, can also produce up to 100,000 unmanned aerial vehicles, or drones, per year, the document said.  Fushan Technology Vietnam did not immediately respond ⁠to a request for comment.

thumbnail.caption: Foxconn’s annual tech day in Taipei

headline: Salesforce Earnings Are Up Next. Sales Growth and AI Are in Focus.
summary: When software giant  Salesforce  reports its third-quarter earnings on Wednesday afternoon, investors will be tracking the company’s progress as it navigates through two inflection points at once.  Salesforce had an unusually long stretch of high sales growth that extended from its founding in 1999 to 2022, never dipping below 20% growth in that period.  At the same time, Salesforce is caught up in the maelstrom of artificial intelligence, and how it could disrupt its business.

content.title: Salesforce Earnings Are Up Next. Sales Growth and AI Are in Focus.
content.summary: When software giant  Salesforce  reports its third-quarter earnings on Wednesday afternoon, investors will be tracking the company’s progress as it navigates through two inflection points at once.  Salesforce had an unusually long stretch of high sales growth that extended from its founding in 1999 to 2022, never dipping below 20% growth in that period.  At the same time, Salesforce is caught up in the maelstrom of artificial intelligence, and how it could disrupt its business.

headline: Foxconn, Luxshare plan to add millions to Vietnam's game console output, documents show
summary: Foxconn and Luxshare plan to add millions of gaming devices to Vietnam's annual output, according to documents they submitted to local authorities, reinforcing the country's role in the global supply of ​game consoles.  Vietnam assembles a variety of electronic products destined for foreign markets, including smartphones, computers and tablets.  Information on ‌its production of consoles is not public, but EV Foxconn, a subsidiary of the Taiwanese manufacturer, has capacity to produce up to 4 million gaming devices in ‌a factory in Northern Vietnam, according to a company document from 2024.

content.title: Foxconn, Luxshare plan to add millions to Vietnam's game console output, documents show
content.summary: Foxconn and Luxshare plan to add millions of gaming devices to Vietnam's annual output, according to documents they submitted to local authorities, reinforcing the country's role in the global supply of ​game consoles.  Vietnam assembles a variety of electronic products destined for foreign markets, including smartphones, computers and tablets.  Information on ‌its production of consoles is not public, but EV Foxconn, a subsidiary of the Taiwanese manufacturer, has capacity to produce up to 4 million gaming devices in ‌a factory in Northern Vietnam, according to a company document from 2024.

headline: Salesforce’s Stock Is Historically Cheap as AI Risk Takes a Toll
summary: The maker of customer relationship management software reports earnings after the bell, and has recently pointed to better times ahead, forecasting double-digit revenue growth in the coming years.  “We need a change in sentiment for investors to take a look, and that will be driven by stability and an improvement in topline growth,” said Hilary Frisch, senior research analyst at ClearBridge Investments.  Salesforce’s stock price has been hammered by pessimism all year, plunging 30% in 2025 to make the company the second-worst performer in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and putting it among the 25 worst in the S&P 500 Index.

content.title: Salesforce’s Stock Is Historically Cheap as AI Risk Takes a Toll

Salesforce’s stock price has been hammered by pessimism all year, plunging 30% in 2025 to make the company the second-worst performer in the Dow Jones Industrial Average and putting it among the 25 worst in the S&P 500 Index.

headline: CrowdStrike Beat Earnings Expectations. Why the Stock Is Falling.
summary: Cybersecurity standout,  CrowdStrike  Holdings reported strong third-quarter earnings results Tuesday afternoon.  Its shares were falling in premarket trading.  Adjusted earnings-per-share were 96 cents, ahead of Wall Street’s consensus estimate of 94 cents, up from 76 cents last year.

content.title: CrowdStrike Beat Earnings Expectations. Why the Stock Is Falling.
content.summary: Cybersecurity standout,  CrowdStrike  Holdings reported strong third-quarter earnings results Tuesday afternoon.  Its shares were falling in premarket trading. Powered by Microsoft Copilot, Insights Agent helps heavy equipment dealerships turn complex business data into actionable insights to drive smarter, faster decisions. It allows dealers to frame simple natural language queries that automatically generate powerful analytics, comprehensive reporting, predictive recommendations, and decision support through the power of AI married to VitalEdge’s deep domain expertise.

headline: Does the Recent Pullback in Box Share Price Offer a 2025 Opportunity?

Box closed at $30.17 recently, and while it is down 6.0% over the last month and 12.3% over the past year, the stock is still up 73.1% over five years and 8.5% over three years. headline: Tech Is Getting Left Behind in the S&P 500’s Latest Rebound
summary: Eli Lilly & Co, Cardinal Health Inc. and Biogen Inc. are among the top 10 performers in the S&P 500 since Oct. 28, the last time the index closed at a record.  In contrast, the S&P 500 Information Technology index is down 4.2% since then, with bigger losses coming from Magnificent Seven stocks like Nvidia Corp. and Microsoft Corp.  The moves suggest that investor are still skittish about the artificial intelligence trade as concerns linger about valuations and whether all the heavy spending on computing power will pay off with profits.

content.title: Tech Is Getting Left Behind in the S&P 500’s Latest Rebound
content.summary: Eli Lilly & Co, Cardinal Health Inc. and Biogen Inc. are among the top 10 performers in the S&P 500 since Oct. 28, the last time the index closed at a record.  In contrast, the S&P 500 Information Technology index is down 4.2% since then, with bigger losses coming from Magnificent Seven stocks like Nvidia Corp. and Microsoft Corp.  The moves suggest that investor are still skittish about the artificial intelligence trade as concerns linger about valuations and whether all the heavy spending on computing power will pay off with profits.

headline: AU10TIX Joins Microsoft Security Store to Advance Secure, Decentralized Identity Verification
summary: AU10TIX, a global leader in identity verification and management, today announced its selection by Microsoft as a premier identity verification (IDV) issuer on the Microsoft Entra platform. This collaboration marks a major milestone in AU10TIX's "Verify Once, Use Everywhere" strategy, bringing its advanced IDV and biometric technology to Microsoft Entra Verified ID to deliver secure, decentralized credentials that strengthen security for over 600 million users worldwide.

content.title: AU10TIX Joins Microsoft Security Store to Advance Secure, Decentralized Identity Verification
content.summary: AU10TIX, a global leader in identity verification and management, today announced its selection by Microsoft as a premier identity verification (IDV) issuer on the Microsoft Entra platform. This collaboration marks a major milestone in AU10TIX's "Verify Once, Use Everywhere" strategy, bringing its advanced IDV and biometric technology to Microsoft Entra Verified ID to deliver secure, decentralized credentials that strengthen security for over 600 million users worldwide.

thumbnail.caption: AU10TIX (PRNewsfoto/AU10TIX)

headline: Nvidia Stock Drops. What Amazon’s New Chips Mean for the AI Leader.
summary: Nvidia  stock was falling Wednesday, pushed down by the threat of competition from  Amazon.com  new AI hardware.  Nvidia’s competition is Amazon’s new Trainium 3 AI chips, which the e-commerce company launched for customers on Tuesday.  Although Amazon said its chips can reduce the cost of training and operating AI models by up to 50% compared with systems that use equivalent graphics processing units, which are Nvidia’s specialty, the two companies still appear on relatively friendly terms.

content.title: Nvidia Stock Drops. What Amazon’s New Chips Mean for the AI Leader.
content.summary: Nvidia  stock was falling Wednesday, pushed down by the threat of competition from  Amazon.com  new AI hardware.  Nvidia’s competition is Amazon’s new Trainium 3 AI chips, which the e-commerce company launched for customers on Tuesday.  Although Amazon said its chips can reduce the cost of training and operating AI models by up to 50% compared with systems that use equivalent graphics processing units, which are Nvidia’s specialty, the two companies still appear on relatively friendly terms.

headline: AI race's new contenders, ADP reports loss of 32K jobs in November
summary: Morning Brief host Julie Hyman brings you the latest financial and market news for December 3, 2025 Recently, OpenAI's Sam Altman declared a "code red" as the AI competition intensifies. Our panel examines the competition in the AI arms race between OpenAI, Gemini, Nvidia, and Microsoft. Also, Julie speaks with Aadil Zaman, Wall Street Alliance partner, about why he believes Google is leading in AI. Zaman discusses where investors should be exposed, a market pullback, and a shift from AI leaders to enablers. US stocks jumped after a weak ADP report for November, which showed hiring at US companies fell by the most since 2023. Private sector jobs decreased by 32,000 last month. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: AI race's new contenders, ADP reports loss of 32K jobs in November

Morning Brief host Julie Hyman brings you the latest financial and market news for December 3, 2025

Recently, OpenAI's Sam Altman declared a "code red" as the AI competition intensifies. Our panel examines the competition in the AI arms race between OpenAI, Gemini, Nvidia, and Microsoft.

Also, Julie speaks with Aadil Zaman, Wall Street Alliance partner, about why he believes Google is leading in AI. Zaman discusses where investors should be exposed, a market pullback, and a shift from AI leaders to enablers.

US stocks jumped after a weak ADP report for November, which showed hiring at US companies fell by the most since 2023. Private sector jobs decreased by 32,000 last month.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Microsoft denies report of lowering targets for AI software sales growth
summary: Microsoft on Wednesday denied a report from The Information that multiple divisions at the company lowered sales growth targets for certain artificial intelligence products after several sales staff missed their goals in the fiscal year that ​ended in June.  The source-based report cited two salespeople in the Azure cloud-computing unit, which is closely watched by investors as ‌it is the main beneficiary of Microsoft's AI push.  "The Information's story inaccurately combines the concepts of growth and sales quotas, which shows their lack of understanding of the way ‌a sales organization works and is compensated," a company spokesperson said in a statement.

content.title: Microsoft denies report of lowering targets for AI software sales growth
content.summary: Microsoft on Wednesday denied a report from The Information that multiple divisions at the company lowered sales growth targets for certain artificial intelligence products after several sales staff missed their goals in the fiscal year that ​ended in June.  The source-based report cited two salespeople in the Azure cloud-computing unit, which is closely watched by investors as ‌it is the main beneficiary of Microsoft's AI push.  "The Information's story inaccurately combines the concepts of growth and sales quotas, which shows their lack of understanding of the way ‌a sales organization works and is compensated," a company spokesperson said in a statement.

headline: Salesforce Reports Mounting Profits. The Stock Is Rising.
summary: Salesforce  stock reported mixed third-quarter earnings results Wednesday afternoon.  Adjusted earnings-per-share were $3.25, well ahead of Wall Street’s consensus estimate of $2.86 cents, up from $2.41 last year.  Profitability soared in the third quarter as seen in the earnings beat and in the company’s adjusted operating profit margin of 35.5%, ahead of expectations of 34.1%, and up from 33.1% last year.

content.summary: Salesforce  stock reported mixed third-quarter earnings results Wednesday afternoon.  Adjusted earnings-per-share were $3.25, well ahead of Wall Street’s consensus estimate of $2.86 cents, up from $2.41 last year.  Profitability soared in the third quarter as seen in the earnings beat and in the company’s adjusted operating profit margin of 35.5%, ahead of expectations of 34.1%, and up from 33.1% last year.

headline: UiPath Reports Third Quarter Fiscal 2026 Financial Results
summary: NEW YORK, December 03, 2025--UiPath, Inc. (NYSE: PATH), a global leader in agentic automation, today announced financial results for its third quarter fiscal 2026 ended October 31, 2025.

headline: Meet the New AI Winners: Alphabet, Tesla and Even Big Pharma and Biotech
summary: Alphabet  may have pulled ahead of OpenAI in the battle for artificial-intelligence supremacy.  Jordi Visser, a senior managing director for 22V Research, said in a report last week that the rise of so-called Vision Language Models, which can process and learn from images and video as well as text, should be great news for  Tesla  thanks to its focus on robotics.  “The next phase of AI isn’t about more datacenters, it’s about power infrastructure, flexible demand, and physical-world automation,” Visser wrote.

headline: Walmart Stock Rallies, Pushing Market Cap Above $900 Billion
summary: Walmart is poised to close above a $900 billion market value for the first time.  The retailer’s stock is up about 2% today, a gain that would push it above the market-cap milestone and make it the 12th U.S. company to surpass it, according to Dow Jones Market Data.  Last month, as the holiday shopping season approached, Walmart executives said that it is winning over more people in all income groups, with the biggest gains coming from higher-income shoppers.

headline: Bears Calling the AI Top Might Be Early - Very Early
summary: While skeptics call for an AI bubble, the data suggests the opposite: we are only in the early innings. With supportive macro conditions, expanding real-world adoption, and valuations far from dot-com extremes, the AI trade still offers meaningful upside.
